result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other colleciton--bail to apply.

Huber for work and school. Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. Provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.****Sept. 19, 2014/Judge Konkol, ORDER:  Defendant's request for E.S. is denied as it would depreciate the seriosness of the offense, defendant's request for release privileges is granted for MEDICAL RELEASES.*****
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry D Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order denying request for additional release privileges received and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant and State./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to work 7 days a week at 2 jobs.
Order allowing defendant to be released for medical purposes received and filed.  Court denies electronic monitoring.  Copies mailed to defendant and State./ds
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/21/14. AR

Defendant Larry D Williams in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.    Statements by counsel, Gerard M. and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with Huber for work and school and 5 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection - bail to apply.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Larry D Williams in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 618.  jew
Court rules on State's Motions in Limine.

Defendant Larry D Williams in court with Trisha Fritz, student, with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court verifies with the defendant his middle initial is "D".  Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  On motion of the defense, Court orders witnesses sequestered.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Micahel Driscoll; Exhibit #1 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence; Milwaukee Police Officer Jeffrey Krueger.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds with the odor of the marijuana and the seeds there was probable cause to arrest the defendant and had reason to search the vehicle and the search was lawful.  Defense motion is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Reply to Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds
State's Motion in Limine received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Search received and filed./ds

Defendant Larry D Williams in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 3-17-14; response/reply by 4-3-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Larry D Williams in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of Richard Johnson for attorney Debra J Patterson.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Randy Sitzberger for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/19/14.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Larry D Williams in court with Student Intern Trisha Fritz under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Larry D Williams in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
